column4: I am having a huge issue with my install of Ubuntu on my netbook.  When I try to install with wubi (my preference) I get told that "no root file system is defined. Please correct this list from the partition menu"  I have tried almost everything and nothing works.  I attempted to do a normal install, but when i go to install it, gparted says that I have no partitions on my drive, so i ran fdisk -l and it shows the partitions there.  I just want
you need to have a ext3 or ext4 partition defined large enough for the install, as well as a linux-swap partition
Wubi won't create the partition unless you have a root i.e. "/" set as the mountpoint in the wubi installer
